recipeIngredient.@value: 1 bottle Marionâs Kitchen Thai Spicy SatayÂ (go to where to buyÂ to find a store)
finely sliced long red chillies, to serve (optional)
coriander and Thai basil leaves to serve
600g chicken thigh or breast fillets, cut into roughly 3cm cubes

recipeInstructions.@value: InstructionsSTEP 1 Preheat oven grill on high. STEP 2 Combine the chicken with half the bottle of Thai Spicy Satay Sauce. Pour the chicken out onto a baking tray lined with foil. Spread the pieces out. Cook under the oven grill for 15-20 minutes or until cooked through. STEP 3 In the meantime, cook the rice vermicelli in boiling water for 2 minutes or until tender.Â  Drain and rinse under running water or plunge into iced water until cool. Divide the noodles among four serving bowls. STEP 4 To serve, top the noodles with the cucumber and the cooked chicken. Top with chillies if using, the herbs and serve with extra satay sauce to drizzle over and a lime wedge. TIPS & TRICKS:Make this a meat-free dish by using the marinade with firm tofu and char grill it instead of the chicken.
